    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WindowBox()
      Creates a WindowBox which is permanent (no auto-hide), non-modal, has a "minimize"- and "close"-button in the top-right corner and is not resizeable.
      WindowBox(boolean resizeable)
      Creates a WindowBox which is permanent, non-modal, has a "minimize"- and "close"-button and is optionally resizeable.
      WindowBox(boolean showCloseIcon, boolean resizeable)
      Creates a WindowBox which is permanent and nonmodal, optionally resizeable and/or has a "minimize"- and "close"-button.
      WindowBox(boolean showMinimizeIcon, boolean showCloseIcon, boolean resizeable)
      Creates a WindowBox which is permanent and nonmodal, optionally resizeable and/or has a "minimize"- and "close"-button.
      WindowBox(boolean modal, boolean showMinimizeIcon, boolean showCloseIcon, boolean resizeable)
      Creates a WindowBox which is permanent, optionally modal, resizeable and/or has a "minimize"- and "close"-button.
      WindowBox(boolean autoHide, boolean modal, boolean showMinimizeIcon, boolean showCloseIcon, boolean resizeable)
      Creates an empty WindowBox with all configuration options.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WindowBox

        public WindowBox()
        Creates a WindowBox which is permanent (no auto-hide), non-modal, has a "minimize"- and "close"-button in the top-right corner and is not resizeable. The dialog box should not be shown until a child widget has been added using #add(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget).

        This is the equivalent for calling WindowBox(false, false, true, false).
        See Also:
        WindowBox(boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean)

      • WindowBox

        public WindowBox(boolean resizeable)
        Creates a WindowBox which is permanent, non-modal, has a "minimize"- and "close"-button and is optionally resizeable. The dialog box should not be shown until a child widget has been added using setWidget(Widget).
        Parameters:
        resizeable - true to allow resizing by dragging the borders
        See Also:
        WindowBox(boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean)

      • WindowBox

        public WindowBox(boolean showCloseIcon,
                 boolean resizeable)
        Creates a WindowBox which is permanent and nonmodal, optionally resizeable and/or has a "minimize"- and "close"-button. The dialog box should not be shown until a child widget has been added using setWidget(Widget).
        Parameters:
        resizeable - true to allow resizing by dragging the borders
        showCloseIcon - true to show "close"-icon in the top right corner of the header
        See Also:
        WindowBox(boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean)

      • WindowBox

        public WindowBox(boolean showMinimizeIcon,
                 boolean showCloseIcon,
                 boolean resizeable)
        Creates a WindowBox which is permanent and nonmodal, optionally resizeable and/or has a "minimize"- and "close"-button. The dialog box should not be shown until a child widget has been added using setWidget(Widget).
        Parameters:
        showMinimizeIcon - true to show "minimize"-icon int the top right corner of the header
        resizeable - true to allow resizing by dragging the borders
        showCloseIcon - true to show "close"-icon in the top right corner of the header
        See Also:
        WindowBox(boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean)

      • WindowBox

        public WindowBox(boolean modal,
                 boolean showMinimizeIcon,
                 boolean showCloseIcon,
                 boolean resizeable)
        Creates a WindowBox which is permanent, optionally modal, resizeable and/or has a "minimize"- and "close"-button. The dialog box should not be shown until a child widget has been added using setWidget(Widget).
        Parameters:
        modal - true if keyboard and mouse events for widgets not contained by the dialog should be ignored
        showMinimizeIcon - true to show "minimize"-icon int the top right corner of the header
        resizeable - true to allow resizing by dragging the borders
        showCloseIcon - true to show "close"-icon in the top right corner of the header

      • WindowBox

        public WindowBox(boolean autoHide,
                 boolean modal,
                 boolean showMinimizeIcon,
                 boolean showCloseIcon,
                 boolean resizeable)
        Creates an empty WindowBox with all configuration options. The dialog box should not be shown until a child widget has been added using setWidget(Widget).
        Parameters:
        autoHide - true if the dialog should be automatically hidden when the user clicks outside of it
        modal - true if keyboard and mouse events for widgets not contained by the dialog should be ignored
        showMinimizeIcon - true to show "minimize"-icon int the top right corner of the header
        showCloseIcon - true to show "close"-icon in the top right corner of the header
        resizeable - true to allow resizing by dragging the borders
        See Also:
        DialogBox#DialogBox(), DialogBox#DialogBox(boolean), DialogBox#DialogBox(boolean, boolean)

    • Method Detail

      • updateCursor

        protected static void updateCursor(int dm,
                                   Element element)
        Static helper method to change the cursor for a given element when resizing is enabled.
        Parameters:
        dm - The code describing the position of the element in question
        element - The com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element to set the cursor on

      • updateCursor

        protected void updateCursor(int dragMode)
        Sets the cursor to indicate resizability for a specified "drag-mode" (i.e. how the box is being resized) on the dialog box. The position is described by an integer, as follows: 
          0-- --1-- --2
  |           |
  
  |           |
  3    -1     5
  |           |
  
  |           |
  6-- --7-- --8
        passing -1 resets the cursor to the default.
        Parameters:
        dragMode -

      • isResizable

        public boolean isResizable()
        Returns whether the dialog box is mouse-resizeable
        Returns:
        true if the user can resize the dialog with the mouse

      • setResizable

        public void setResizable(boolean resizable)
        Set the dialog box to be resizeable by the user
        Parameters:
        resizable - true if the user can resize the dialog with the mouse

      • onBrowserEvent

        public void onBrowserEvent(Event event)

      • getRelX

        private int getRelX(Element resize,
                    int clientX)
        Recalculation of X-coordinate
        Parameters:
        resize - resizeable element
        clientX - input value of x-coordinate
        Returns:
        new value of x-coordinate

      • getRelY

        private int getRelY(Element resize,
                    int clientY)
        Recalculation of Y-coordinate
        Parameters:
        resize - resizeable element
        clientY - input value of y-coordinate
        Returns:
        new value of y-coordinate

      • calcDragMode

        protected int calcDragMode(int clientX,
                           int clientY)
        Calculates the position of the mouse relative to the dialog box, and returns the corresponding "drag-mode" integer, which describes which area of the box is being resized.
        Parameters:
        clientX - The x-coordinate of the mouse in screen pixels
        clientY - The y-coordinate of the mouse in screen pixels
        Returns:
        A value in range [-1..8] describing the position of the mouse (see updateCursor(int) for more information)

      • dragResizeWidget

        protected void dragResizeWidget(PopupPanel panel,
                                int dx,
                                int dy)
        Convenience method to set the height, width and position of the given widget
        Parameters:
        panel -
        dx -
        dy -

        public void setCloseIconVisible(boolean visible)
        Set whether the "close"-button should appear in the top right corner of the header
        Parameters:

      • setMinimizeIconVisible

        public void setMinimizeIconVisible(boolean visible)
        Set whether the "minimize"-button should appear in the top right corner of the header
        Parameters:
        visible - true if a "minimize"-button should be shown

      • getControlPanel

        public FlowPanel getControlPanel()
        Returns the FlowPanel that contains the controls. More controls can be added directly to this.

      • onCloseClick

        protected void onCloseClick(ClickEvent event)
        Called when the close icon is clicked. The default implementation hides the dialog box.
        Parameters:
        event - The ClickEvent to handle

      • onMinimizeClick

        protected void onMinimizeClick(ClickEvent event)
        Called when the minimize icon is clicked. The default implementation hides the container of the dialog box.
        Parameters:
        event - The ClickEvent to handle

      • addOpenHandler

        public HandlerRegistration addOpenHandler(<any> handler)

      • show

        public void show()

      • setMinWidth

        public void setMinWidth(int minWidth)
        Sets the minimum width to which this widget can be resized by the user, if resizing is enabled. If the value is invalid, it is reset to MIN_WIDTH
        Parameters:
        minWidth - A positive int value

      • setMinHeight

        public void setMinHeight(int minHeight)
        Sets the minimum height to which this widget can be resized by the user, if resizing is enabled. If the value is invalid, it is reset to MIN_WIDTH
        Parameters:
        minHeight - A positive int value
